qas.question: The Saronic gulf is near what city?
The Cyclade islands are located where?

answers.text: central part of the Aegean Sea

qas.question: The North Aegean islands are located where?
The Dodecanese islands are located where?
The Sporades islands are located where?

answers.text: off the coast of northeast Euboea

context: The Greek islands are traditionally grouped into the following clusters: The Argo-Saronic Islands in the Saronic gulf near <a0_0>Athens<a0_0/>, the Cyclades, a large but dense collection occupying the <a1_0>central part of the Aegean Sea<a1_0/>, the North Aegean islands, a loose grouping off the <a2_0>west coast of Turkey<a2_0/>, the Dodecanese, another loose collection in the southeast <a3_0>between Crete and Turkey<a3_0/>, the Sporades, a small tight group <a4_0>off the coast of northeast Euboea<a4_0/>, and the Ionian Islands, located to the west of the mainland in the Ionian Sea.
